operation.title: Operation
operation.description: Explicit operation to perform: "create", "read", "update", "delete", or "find". If not specified, operation will be inferred from context: has fieldDataJson + recordId = update, has fieldDataJson only = create, has recordId only = read, has searchTerm/filtersJson = find, has recordId only (no data/search) = delete.

fieldDataJson.title: Field Data JSON
fieldDataJson.description: JSON string containing Meeting__c field data. For create: {"Subject__c":"Product demo","Meeting_Type__c":"In-Person Visit","Meeting_Date__c":"2024-12-31"}. For update: {"Meeting_Status__c":"Completed","Meeting_Outcome__c":"Positive"}. For bulk operations: [{"Subject__c":"Meeting 1"},{"Subject__c":"Meeting 2"}]. Required for create/update operations. The agent should construct this JSON from natural language user input. AGENT INTELLIGENCE: Use semantic understanding to map natural language to structured fields. For picklist fields, analyze context and select the most appropriate value from available options. Query availableFieldsJson to see valid picklist values. If input does not clearly map, leave the field blank.

recordId.title: Record ID
recordId.description: The Salesforce record ID (15 or 18 character) of the Meeting. Required for read/update/delete operations. Format: 18-character ID like "a00xx000003DGbYAAW". For update, can be omitted if Subject__c is provided in fieldDataJson for automatic resolution. The agent should resolve this from meeting subject when possible rather than asking the user for an ID.

searchTerm.title: Search Term
searchTerm.description: Text to search for in Meeting fields (Subject__c, Description__c, etc.). Used for find operations. Example: "Product demo" or "lunch". IMPORTANT: If the user wants to find a meeting but hasn't provided a search term, ask them for the meeting subject, account/contact name, or other identifying information BEFORE calling this action. Do not call find operation without a searchTerm or filtersJson.

filtersJson.title: Filters JSON
filtersJson.description: JSON string of exact-match filters for find operations. Can be single object {"fieldApiName":"Meeting_Type__c","value":"In-Person Visit"} or array [{"fieldApiName":"Meeting_Type__c","value":"In-Person Visit"}]. IMPORTANT: If the user wants to find a meeting but hasn't provided specific filters, ask them for details like account/contact name, meeting date, or meeting type BEFORE calling this action. Do not call find operation without a searchTerm or filtersJson.

searchLimit.title: Search Limit
searchLimit.description: Maximum number of records to return for find operations (default: 5, max: 20).

accountName.title: Account Name
accountName.description: Account name to resolve to Account__c lookup. If provided, system searches for an Account and links the Meeting to it.

contactNameOrEmail.title: Contact Name or Email
contactNameOrEmail.description: Contact name or email to resolve to Contact__c lookup. If provided, system searches for a Contact and links the Meeting to them.

confirm.title: Confirm
confirm.description: For create/update: Set to false to preview only without committing. Default (true): Commits immediately. For delete: Set to true to actually delete. Default (false): Returns confirmation message first. The agent should first call delete with confirm=false, ask the user, then call again with confirm=true if confirmed.
